result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sunshine K Ketchum

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 
13CF1258
Ct 1- 6 years WPS, 3 years init, 3 years es (364 days credit)

15CF875
Ct 1- 6 years WPS, 3 years init, 3 years es, to run concurrent to ct 1 in 13CF1258 (153 days credit)

Ct 2- 6 years WPS, 3 years init, 3 years es, i/s, 5 years probation, to run consecutive to ct 1 in 13CF1258 and ct 1 in 15CF875 

Ct 5- 6 years WPS, 3 years init, 3 years es, i/s, 5 years probabtion, to run consecutive to ct 1 & ct 2 in 15CF875 & ct 1 in 13CF1258
 
15CF976 - File is DRI will not receive credit

Conditions:
No drug / no alcohol
Maintain recovery program
Provide DNA Sample + pay fee
Waive court costs
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Comply with family court orders
No contact with J.M, G.S. A.M. or R.P.
Obtain HSD 
Obtain job skills, obtain and maintain full time elpy once release
Once released - live in a sober living facilty for 6 months
VOTE
FAW
Eligable for CIP & ERP

Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - In 15CF875 Plea to Cts, 1, 2 and 5, DRI Cts 3-4 and 6-10, and 15CF976
Rights given
P - No Contest
BTC: Finding of guilt - 15CF875 Counts 1, 2 & 5; DRI Cts 3, 4,  6-10, and 15CF976. Updated PSI needed. Bond in 13CF1258 modified to $1000 cash
Def - Req bond modified in the 15CF875 file
St - Obj to modification
BTC: Motion for bond modification in 15CF875 denied.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 11:00 am.
allowing 14CF875 & 14CF976 to be transferred to Br 4
Proposed Order to transfer cases; received from Atty Glinski.  Fwd to Judge for review and signature.
filed by Atty Glinski, re: proposed Order.

Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Defense indicates deft has an older case in front of Br 4 that will be sentenced next month. Defense is asking that these two cases be transferred to Br 4 so all matters may be resolved at once.

BTC: Granted. Defense to prepare an order for the Courts signature.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
